body_html:
By the way, it seems reasonably easy to accidentally go over the line limit. I considered some options; the option I like best is to turn off line linting altogether: 296eb1e#diff-b91f3d5bd63fcd17221b267e851608e8

But we can do more surgical things; for example, turn off line length linting for test files only, or explicitly mark expect lines that are long with # noqa. There aren't any cases of this yet, so I haven't done anything.
body_text:
By the way, it seems reasonably easy to accidentally go over the line limit. I considered some options; the option I like best is to turn off line linting altogether: 296eb1e#diff-b91f3d5bd63fcd17221b267e851608e8
But we can do more surgical things; for example, turn off line length linting for test files only, or explicitly mark expect lines that are long with # noqa. There aren't any cases of this yet, so I haven't done anything.
body:
By the way, it seems reasonably easy to accidentally go over the line limit. I considered some options; the option I like best is to turn off line linting altogether: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/12825/commits/296eb1e1ea5179663817c09961eb27af436af087#diff-b91f3d5bd63fcd17221b267e851608e8

But we can do more surgical things; for example, turn off line length linting for test files only, or explicitly mark expect lines that are long with `# noqa`. There aren't any cases of this yet, so I haven't done anything.
